DOC.brief_summary: The safety and efficacy of Mentor Purified Toxin, Botulinum Toxin Type A, Purified Neurotoxin, injected intramuscularly into the neck, is being evaluated as a treatment for painful and non-painful spasmodic torticollis/cervical dystonia. It is hypothesized that treatment will decrease symptom severity and will not have any significant side effects.
DOC.brief_title: PurTox (Botulinum Toxin Type A) for the Treatment of Adult Onset Spasmodic Torticollis/Cervical Dystonia
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of torticollis with noticeable symptoms for at least 6 months Total TWSTRS score greater or equal to 20, TWSTRS severity score greater than or equal to 10 and TWSTRS Disability score greater than or equal to 3 (must meet all 3 criteria) Diagnosis of isolated anterocollis Concurrent myopathic disease, myotonic dystrophy (or other form of muscular dystrophy), myasthenia gravis Currently receiving aminoglycoside antibiotic therapy, curarelike drugs, quinidine, succinylcholine, polymixins, anticholinesterases, magnesium sulfate, or lincosamides Any illness that is considered by the Investigator to make the subject an inappropriate candidate Cervical spine injury within 18 months or head and neck surgery within 6 months prior to screening Preexisting dysphagia History of active autoimmune disease Exposure to botulinum toxin based pharmaceutical within 3 months prior to screening History of primary nonresponse or secondary resistance with prior exposure to botulinum based pharmaceuticals History of chemotherapy/radiation for malignant disease within 24 months Any investigational drug/device during the 30 days prior to screening
